title: Multi-Epoch Learning for Deep Click-Through Rate Prediction Models. (arXiv:2305.19531v1 [cs.IR])
abstract: The one-epoch overfitting phenomenon has been widely observed in industrial Click-Through Rate (CTR) applications, where the model performance experiences a significant degradation at the beginning of the second epoch. Recent advances try to understand the underlying factors behind this phenomenon through extensive experiments. However, it is still unknown whether a multi-epoch training paradigm could achieve better results, as the best performance is usually achieved by one-epoch training. In this paper, we hypothesize that the emergence of this phenomenon may be attributed to the susceptibility of the embedding layer to overfitting, which can stem from the high-dimensional sparsity of data. To maintain feature sparsity while simultaneously avoiding overfitting of embeddings, we propose a novel Multi-Epoch learning with Data Augmentation (MEDA), which can be directly applied to most deep CTR models. translated_abstract: 在工业点击率（CTR）应用中，经常观察到一次过度拟合现像，即模型在第二个时期开始时性能显著降低。最近的进展尝试通过广泛的实验来了解这种现象背后的基本因素。然而，仍然不知道多时期培训范式是否能够取得更好的结果，因为最好的表现通常是通过一时期的训练实现的。在本文中，我们假设这种现象的出现可能归因于嵌入层对过度拟合的敏感性，而这可以源自数据的高维稀疏性。为了在同时避免嵌入的过度拟合和保持特征稀疏性，我们提出了一种新颖的基于数据增强的多时期学习（MEDA），它可以直接应用于大多数深度CTR模型。MEDA通过在每个时期重新初始化嵌入层来实现数据增强。
tldr: 这篇论文提出了一种新颖的多时期学习方法（MEDA）用于深度CTR模型，通过在每个时期重新初始化嵌入层来避免嵌入层的过度拟合和保持特征稀疏性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel multi-epoch learning method (MEDA) for deep CTR models, which avoids overfitting of the embedding layer and maintains feature sparsity by reinitializing the embedding layer in each epoch.
